post: Working families have found their biggest advocates in the Trump Administration. We will never stop fighting for you!
PROMISES MADE, PROMISES KEPT!

President Trump continues to deny the scientific evidence in front of his own eyes — and we’re all paying the price. We must get him out of the White House and treat climate change like the existential threat it is.

We must restore our nation's commitment to humane and effective immigration policies. As president, I'll provide a fair and just system that helps to grow and enhance our economy, and secure our cherished values.

The one truly sacred obligation our government has is to properly train and equip the men and women who defend our nation at war and to care for them and their families—while they’re deployed, and after they come home. We need a president who will honor that obligation.

Some candidates jet off to Manhattan or San Francisco for fancy fundraisers that cost more than $2,000 a ticket.Not me. We’re building our campaign one small-dollar donation at a time—because the presidency shouldn’t be bought by the wealthy and well-connected. Chip in $3 now to join us.

We’re weeks away from the first caucuses and primaries. If a few more people on Facebook chip in tonight, we’ll be on track to grow our grassroots movement before voting begins.I’m deeply grateful for any amount you’re able to give.

Some people dismiss any investment in middle-class families as “free stuff.”You know who's getting free stuff? Amazon, which had $10 billion in profits this year and is paying $0 in federal income taxes.Working families are paying their fair share—let’s invest in them.

I don't sell access to my time. I don't do closed-door fundraisers. And I don't ask for a $1,000 contribution for a selfie. If you want to know about a candidate’s commitment to reform, don’t just look at what they say they will do—look at what they’re doing right now.

Wall Street executives and billionaires are spending their time and money attacking me—they believe I'm the biggest threat to a corrupt system that has enriched them at everyone else’s expense. They are right.I do have a plan to make real change.

Corporate-backed think tanks pretend that America’s obscene income inequality was inevitable. Technology, globalization and automation are responsible, they claim. There's nothing we can do to stop it. Well, the last time I checked, Western Europe also competes in the global economy, and they managed to keep their middle class.Make no mistake: inequality is a political choice. And when we stand up and fight for policies that empower working families and make the rich pay their fair share, we will create an economy that works for everyone—not just the top 1%.
Mr. Trump and the GOP passed a tax scam two years ago. They said it would create jobs and boost wages.Big surprise: none of that happened—but who got richer? Their millionaire and billionaire donors.

I have long believed that democracy isn't just voting every four years—it’s about ordinary people creating community, engaging in the political process together, and building powerful grassroots movements to achieve progressive change. And that’s exactly what we’re doing.

We have people working 50, 60, 70 hours a week just to put food on the table, just to make sure that their families can live with a modicum of dignity. And the reason for all of that is that wages in the United States of America are just too low, and the time is long overdue for us to raise the minimum wage to a living wage.

Let’s build a country unified around bold solutions.

Governor Sununu should follow the independent fact-finder report and agree to a contract that shows Granite State workers the respect they deserve.I'm from a union family. As President I'll stand strong with unions.

In America, 1 in 6 renting households spend more than half of their monthly income on rent. We have a housing crisis and we need a radical plan to ensure people are able to access this basic human right.

You should be able to afford health care for your family. You should be able to retire with dignity and respect. And you should be able to give your children the kind of education that allows them to dream bigger, go farther and accomplish even more than you could ever imagine.
Gun manufacturers should be held accountable for their role in our nation’s gun violence epidemic. We need to end legal immunity and help survivors of gun violence seek justice.

There isn’t a single county in the US where a full-time worker making minimum wage can afford a 2-bedroom apartment at fair-market rent. That’s why we need to increase the supply of affordable units and pass a renters tax credit to ensure the basic right of housing for all.
